com.atakmap.android.layers

Class RangeSeekBar<T extends java.lang.Number>

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.widget.ImageView
        • com.atakmap.android.layers.RangeSeekBar<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The Number type of the range values. One of Long, Double, Integer, Float, Short, Byte or BigDecimal.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback

    public class RangeSeekBar<T extends java.lang.Number>
extends android.widget.ImageView
    Widget that lets users select a minimum and maximum value on a given numerical range. The range value types can be one of Long, Double, Integer, Float, Short, Byte or BigDecimal.

    Improved MotionEvent handling for smoother use, anti-aliased painting for improved aesthetics.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_COLOR

        public static final int DEFAULT_COLOR
        Default color of a RangeSeekBar, #FF33B5E5. This is also known as "Ice Cream Sandwich" blue.

      • INVALID_POINTER_ID

    • Constructor Detail

      • RangeSeekBar

        public RangeSeekBar(T absoluteMinValue,
                    T absoluteMaxValue,
                    android.content.Context context)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new RangeSeekBar.
        Parameters:
        absoluteMinValue - The minimum value of the selectable range.
        absoluteMaxValue - The maximum value of the selectable range.
        context - the context to use when constructing the rage seeker bar.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be thrown if min/max value type is not one of Long, Double, Integer, Float, Short, Byte or BigDecimal.

        Returns:

      • setSelectedMinValue

        public void setSelectedMinValue(T value)
        Sets the currently selected minimum value. The widget will be invalidated and redrawn.
        Parameters:
        value - The Number value to set the minimum value to. Will be clamped to given absolute minimum/maximum range.

      • getSelectedMaxValue

        public T getSelectedMaxValue()
        Returns the currently selected max value.
        Returns:
        The currently selected max value.

      • setSelectedMaxValue

        public void setSelectedMaxValue(T value)
        Sets the currently selected maximum value. The widget will be invalidated and redrawn.
        Parameters:
        value - The Number value to set the maximum value to. Will be clamped to given absolute minimum/maximum range.

      • onSaveInstanceState

        protected android.os.Parcelable onSaveInstanceState()
        Overridden to save instance state when device orientation changes. This method is called automatically if you assign an id to the RangeSeekBar widget using the View.setId(int) method. Other members of this class than the normalized min and max values don't need to be saved.
        Overrides:
        onSaveInstanceState in class android.view.View

      • setNormalizedMinValue

        public void setNormalizedMinValue(double value)
        Sets normalized min value to value so that 0 <= value <= normalized max value <= 1. The View will get invalidated when calling this method.
        Parameters:
        value - The new normalized min value to set.

      • setNormalizedMaxValue

        public void setNormalizedMaxValue(double value)
        Sets normalized max value to value so that 0 <= normalized min value <= value <= 1. The View will get invalidated when calling this method.
        Parameters:
        value - The new normalized max value to set.
